eshmun.expression.modalities

Class BinaryCTLModality

  • java.lang.Object
    • eshmun.expression.AbstractExpression
      • eshmun.expression.modalities.AbstractCTLModality
        • eshmun.expression.modalities.BinaryCTLModality
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Visitable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AUModality, AVModality, AWModality, EUModality, EVModality, EWModality

    public abstract class BinaryCTLModality
extends AbstractCTLModality
    This class is the superclass of all the binary CTL modalities.

    Contains methods and stores the children of the modality as an AbstractExpression.

    A Binary CTL modality is on the form: A|E(leftChild U|W|V rightChild).

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kinan Dak Al Bab
    See Also:
    AbstractCTLModality, AbstractExpression

      • toCNF

        public AbstractExpression toCNF()
        returns an equivalent expression.

        It is impossible to write a CTL modality in CNF. Thus this method doesn't return a valid CNF Formula.

        This method will re-write the children of this modality in CNF. And return a new instance of this modality with the new children.

        Notice that a child is not guaranteed to be in CNF if the child contains CTL.

        Specified by:
        toCNF in class AbstractExpression
        Returns:
        an equivalent expression with the children in CNF.
        See Also:
        Conversion into CNF

      • directCompare

        protected boolean directCompare(AbstractExpression exp)
        Equality check, this method is only called if the passed expression has the same type as this.

        The internals of the implementation of this method depends on the implementing class.

        Comparison is not done based on pointers rather than based on semantic meaning. Two Expressions are equal if they consist of the same variables (based on Name), and if these variables are connected in the same way.

        Notice that certain Operators are commutative, this doesn't change the equality of two Expression.

        Specified by:
        directCompare in class AbstractExpression
        Parameters:
        exp - the expression to compare with this.
        Returns:
        true if this and the passed object are semantically equal (as Expressions), false otherwise.
